snippet: Despite cheers of welcome in Germany, it remained unclear how Europe would deal with successive waves of people, for months or even years.
abstract: Flow of migrants through Balkans into Europe continues as European Union member countries struggle to find solutions to crisis; debate over how to accommodate thousands of desperate foreigners strains relations between countries; Pope Francis urges Catholic parishes and other religious communities to take in refugees.

byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Vienna, and Rick Lyman from Hegyeshalom, Hungary. Reporting was contributed by Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; Steven Erlanger from London; Melissa Eddy from Berlin; Palko Karasz from Budapest; and Gaia Pianigiani from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Despite cheers of welcome in Germany, it remained unclear how Europe would deal with successive waves of people, for months or even years.

headline.main: As Europe Grasps for Answers, More Migrants Flood Its Borders
headline.print_headline: As Europe Grasps for Answers, More Migrants Flood Its Borders

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
